intro: Lithocarpus llanosii, commonly known as the Llanos stone栎, is a member of the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks and beeches. It is a deciduous tree native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in Venezuela and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves and produces small, hard nuts enclosed in a cupule. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland forests. The botanical features of Lithocarpus llanosii make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitat.
